content: 12 stitches wide for the typical 2 liter hot water bottle size and at given gauge chart a would need 8 pattern repeats around from left to right chart b 7 pattern repeats around the sewn bind off by knitting legend elizabeth directions zimmerman in my opinion is very stretchy a how-to of with judy s magic cast on see notes and mc and this technique can be found at knitty smaller needles cast on 52 sts 26 sts on each www knitty com/issuesummer06/featsum06tt html needle or evenly divided when using dpn s using the magic loop technique knit one round then an interesting topic concerning stranded knitting is yarn knit next round increasing as follows dominance to get the best out of your colourwork you might want to read this k1 m1 by forming a loop see notes k until littlecottonrabbits typepad co uk/my_weblog/2013/05/kn last st of first half m1 by forming a loop k1 itting-tips-fairisle-colourwork html place marker if needed just divide over two needles when doing magic loop do the same and in case you wondered some hot water bottle cozies for the second half of stitches repeat this have openings with buttons and seem easier to put on for every round until you have 80 84 sts but to keep it soft and the design simple i just made one that can be put around the bottle by folding it double and add cc1 and cc2 and changing to bigger into the cozy why take it out every time just fill the needles start knitting the body in bottle with warm water after the cover is on colourwork following chart a or chart b using cc3 when it appears in chart knit the chart repeat from right to left 8 7 times around and depending on the height of your bottle one time from bottom to top the body of the cozy should now have reached a height of aprox 20 cm 8 when you need a different height try to end at a blue or red chart line this wil give you a nice transition from stitch pattern to plain part break off cc s continue with mc and smaller needles when needed for height knit a few more rounds then start decreasing as follows ssk k to last 2 sts k2tog slip marker if there and repeat for second half of stitches continue like this every round until there are 40 sts left 2 begin knitting the cuff k1 *p2 k2* repeat between ** ending round with k1 this order is to make sure the first and last k sts line up nicely with the decreasing ridge see detail picture of cuff repeat round until the neck is long enought to cover the neck of your cozy when folded in my case this was at 15 cm 6 bind of using the sewn bind off see notes or pick any other very stretchy bind off method just make sure the opening will be stretchy
